sense.gloss: type, pattern, model, epitome, exemplar, archetype, perfect example
privilege, special favor, special favour, benefit, prerogative, perk, amenity
sacred scripture, sacred book, holy book, holy writings
favour, favor, act of grace, special privilege
gift brought to a funeral (usu. money), funeral offering, condolence gift, incense money
typical, representative, archetypal, quintessential, stereotypical, model
code of law, body of law
dictionary of Chinese characters, kanji dictionary
Latin (i.e. relating to the literature, culture, etc. of ancient Rome), Roman
Apocrypha (i.e. as opposed to the Biblical canon)
Kangxi dictionary, Chinese dictionary of 1716, which popularized the system of 214 radicals
maid of honor, maid of honour, lady-in-waiting

sdata.j: ↑教養↑↓きょうよう↓のある↑人↑↓ひと↓によくあることだが、↑彼↑↓かれ↓はジャズより↑古典↑↓こてん↓↑音楽↑↓おんがく↓が↑好↑↓す↓きだ。
sdata.e: As is often the case with educated people, he likes classical music better than jazz.

sdata.j: ↑確↑↓たし↓かに、Ｍａｎｋｉｎｄ　Ｑｕａｒｔｅｒｌｙ↑誌↑↓し↓は↑出典↑↓しゅってん↓として↑頼↑↓たよ↓るにはもっとも↑奇妙↑↓きみょう↓なものである。
